p: Infusion of sage leaves, or so-called production of sage tea, is a very popular preparation in folk medicine. This process is very simple, but is conducted quite differently in the research. According to Radulescu, Chiliment, and Oprea [ 38], 100 mL of boiling water are poured over 5 g of leaves of Salvia officinalis L. and filtered after 30 min. In Martins et al. [ 39], 200 mL of boiling water was poured over 1 g of sample, left for 5 min, and then filtered under reduced pressure. In Zimmermann et al. [ 40], 150 mL of boiling water was poured over 1.5 g of sage leaves or tea bags from 16 different brands, steeped for 15 min, and then a filtered 1 mL sample was used for further analysis.
